A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: I really want to love this movie and there are moments that I did actually think were exciting\, yet as I walked out of the theater I realized that was the problem. This is a visually beautiful movie with enough cool scenes to make you forget about the pile of unanswered questions\, useless subplots\, and a tragically uncharacteristic portrayal of one of the franchise's most beloved characters\, Luke Skywalker. Although heavy in \"content\" it leaves only a strange feeling of \"what did I just see\" and what's the point of Ep 9?
